website_summaries.verdict: Very simple design in a punch mitt, but it includes tough materials that are common in boxing gloves.
pros: High-quality backing materials in the punch mitts will give you a high level of performance
Padding in the mitts will remind you more of a sparring glove, as it keeps your hands safe
Includes an anti-microbial coating to avoid soaking up sweaty odors for an easier clean-up process
cons: Not made to stand up to high-level workouts
Mitts may not return to original shape easily after workouts

customer_reviews.title: must have
customer_reviews.text: I waited a while to write this review because I wanted to see how they held up after taking a few beatings. I must say I am impressed. I have used them over 20 times now and although they look a little worn they are not damaged and work great. They fit well and I use Clorox wipes to wipes them down to keep them from smelling. Definitely a great buy! and of course they are way cheaper here on amazon than in retail stores
customer_reviews.author: larissa sperugia

customer_reviews.title: Very light but not good for kicking and hard work
customer_reviews.text: I've been kick boxing for over 10 years, and I bought this mitts to practice at home. It's very light but not good for kicking or heavy work. It's also a little bit small. So it can't hold up heavy punches and kicks. I would recommend to buy mitts that can absorb heavy punches and bigger size as well.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: ... mitts are a little large however they have worked great for me thus far in improving my combinations
customer_reviews.text: These punching mitts are a little large however they have worked great for me thus far in improving my combinations. The size actually makes it a little easier to position and simulate a hook to the body. At their price point its hard to find a better value. *Update* After about a year of ownership and about 20 training sessions with these mits they have now become entirely useless. The threading on the connection between the glove and pad has come out all over. I would recommend spending your money on another set of mits.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: These aren't bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: These aren't bad for the price, but when you're blocking punches with pads your fingers have the natural inclination to bend so you can lessen the blow. These are stiff and allow no movement or bendyness. This caused a lot of pain in my wrists and fingers, because I ended up bending the top of my my fingers and gripping the holes from the side. I managed, but looking back, it could have caused a hand injury. They also do not have any velcro so sometimes your hand feels it might slip out. They're not a bad price, they got the job done. But I will be purchasing more heavy duty ones.
customer_reviews.author: Meredith Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! We got them for our son, who has been training in martial arts for four years. These are an affordable way to practice at home between classes. We have been using them daily for months and they still look like new.
customer_reviews.author: Jessw28

customer_reviews.title: Kool
customer_reviews.text: I like the everlasting punch mitts. I used them for my daughter karate training. She likes them too and goes crazy with her jabs and hooks. Still intact and no tears
customer_reviews.author: ADAM

customer_reviews.title: Large fit but absorbs the blows great
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. The mitts really absorb the shock of the hit, but they are a little difficult for small hands to hold on to. I have to really squeeze my hands in the mitts to keep them from sliding off while absorbing the blow. May work better for someone with bigger/thicker hands. I have very slim hands and fingers to the mitts are VERY loose on me. I am able to get them to work though, and enjoy using them to train with my son.
customer_reviews.author: MeBeCleo

customer_reviews.title: Works for me!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I workout together, and started boxing. These work great for us, but we're no professionals. I have small hands, and the glove part is a bit big, so I just grip my fingers around the top of the finger holes and it works fine. They don't seem cheap to me, and seem reasonably sturdy, but we're just boxing for fun. Bottom line, they work, and I would recommend them to anyone. I feel like, unless you're training for some legit boxing, then these should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Annabelle

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Feels really good hitting or taking the hits. Force well distributed so you don't get hurt no matter what side you're on. The only question remaining is how they will hold up with time. I'll be using these a lot, so I'll put an update in after a while
customer_reviews.author: Michael L.

customer_reviews.title: High quality product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to teach my girlfriend some techniques.. They seem of high-quality and should last for quite some time
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Hockert

customer_reviews.title: Your standard beginner mitts.
customer_reviews.text: Great for beginners, but if you're going with more advanced fighters, you may need to upgrade. The padding is good enough for some jabs and strikes, but if your up against a heavy hitter the padding may leave you with some sore palms. The mitts also have a high chance of slipping off as there isn't any real grip to it. The glove part fits most hand sizes well, but a belt or strap to keep them on would be a lot more helpful. The color is also a little boring.
customer_reviews.author: Dr.Iron

customer_reviews.title: I have to write something?
customer_reviews.text: So, I have to write a review? I can't just give it 5 stars? I like them because... They're... Ummm. I just bought them because Everlast is a reputable brand.
customer_reviews.author: miguel casillas

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Not a quality product. Poor fit. Does not adjust. Does not take impact well. Would not recommend, even for light use.
customer_reviews.author: W Barne

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I like the durability but they arealittle slippery. Next time I'll go for a curved design.
customer_reviews.author: Tamica

customer_reviews.title: mitt stiching breaks
customer_reviews.text: i loved everything about these mitts, except that they fall apart. the mitts are light, feel good on the hand, and inexpensive. in a short period of time, the stiching broke. i could live with pieces along the top falling in the ring, but when the stiches around the hand came undone, the mitts slipped with each punch. i switched to "Pro Impact Curved Focus Mitts Top Grade Leather". the pro impact mitts are solid, very solid, but they are also heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for my 4 year old son
customer_reviews.text: I got these and the Pu Kids children's boxing gloves for my son who needed an appropriate outlet for his aggression. These punch mitts have worked well for our purpose. I read other comments that said they didn't hold up to serious practice and training, but since that wasn't our goal, we opted for them and they've been great for us.
customer_reviews.author: cbfitz

customer_reviews.title: Great mitts!!
customer_reviews.text: Love them!! Started boxing during lockdown with my bf and this mitts are great!!!
customer_reviews.author: Carolj

customer_reviews.title: Great buy.
customer_reviews.text: Great buy. Durable, lightweight ...This company knows what they’re doing. :)
customer_reviews.author: M. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Ok Mitts
customer_reviews.text: These are the first pair of punch mitts that I have gotten and these have not impressed me. The quality of the mitts is OK, the main issue is when actually using them. They can easily fall off as the back of the mitts is very large and loose. These have been used very rarely mainly because of the previous issue.
customer_reviews.author: Alfher

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: does the job...quality is good and seems durable, however, I am not a hardcore user so not sure how it would hold up if used hard.
customer_reviews.author: Amir Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: Not too shabby
customer_reviews.text: A little difficult to keep on my hands (I have child-sized hands!), but great value for the money. The mitts are flat, which makes them ideal for practicing with palm strikes with beginners (which is what I purchased them for).
customer_reviews.author: r0ck3t

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Great quality! I was able to add some boxing drills to my clients workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Marta Cooper

customer_reviews.title: you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: I guess they are ok for the price. The problem is first that there is no way to tighten them. No adjustment strap. It takes a lot of strength in your hands to hold them on. Makes for tired fingers. Second they are hard as a rock. Arms get tired because none of the force of the punch is obsorbed by the mitts. Third they are straight. This makes it hard to keep them at the right angle and again makes your hands and arms tired from taking the full force.
customer_reviews.author: karin

customer_reviews.title: I am happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: Happy with the purchase, the grip around the fingers could have been made better.
customer_reviews.author: CYBERTRON

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, but cheap quality.
customer_reviews.text: Being very soft, not too satisfying to punch at. Very soft, and they can get deformed from strong punches. However, you can bend it right back easily. Not recommended to kick these with high powered taekwondo or muay thai kicks because it's dangerous. You If your fingers are too long and stick out the top, you can get your finger bent backwards.
customer_reviews.author: Zephyrok

customer_reviews.title: Great Punching mitts for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great punch mitts. I have been pounding awat at these gloves and they have held up so far. It sort of gives you that cheap feel because the material for the glove is fairly thin, but it is sewn together well enough. Hope to get plenty of use out of these! I would recommend buying a pair of these.
customer_reviews.author: Scotthew

customer_reviews.title: A nice pair of pads
customer_reviews.text: We've had a nice couple of workouts with these so far. They're pretty firm, but soft enough for an eight-year-old to hit, and they seem very sturdy. The only real reason I didn't give them five stars is the lack of a wrist strap to help hold them on. A couple of times, one of my kids kicked a pad off the hand of the other. Not a big deal, especially as these are clearly meant for boxing practice instead of Tai Kwan Do.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Mccullough

customer_reviews.title: Good but and easy to use. No wear n year yet
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and lasting great so far. We used it for 4 weeks 3 times a week and performs well for beginner and professional
customer_reviews.author: R. Munsen

customer_reviews.title: Great product great price met my surpassed my expectations
customer_reviews.text: So far it’s everything I wanted and was hoping for. I’m using to teach my kids boxing they range from 5 years to 10 and it’s perfect for both young and old
customer_reviews.author: Aubrey

customer_reviews.title: Would buy them again.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect especially for the price. They got here ahead of schedule and they work great. Been using them for sparing practice and have not had any problems yet. The only thing that is weird is that they are meant for either hand. The thumb and pinky slots are the same size so they fit on either hand. Again not a bad thing just strange. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Bill S.

customer_reviews.title: Good punch mitts.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to teach my son Krav Maga and boxing and for my wife and I to stay in practice. I have large hands and the mitts fit my hands well. My wife has small hands and she can also use them with no problems. You just have to apply a small amount of pressure with your fingertips to keep the mitts from slipping or falling off.
customer_reviews.author: Paul P.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: There not top quality but they are usable. The pads are really not bent to where it has an angle, instead its just a flat pad which kind of makes it hard to catch the punches. Also feels cheap, the stitches look like there gonna come out after some use. But overall its good for the price. I would recommend and would rather spend money on this than on a 60-80 dollar pairs.
customer_reviews.author: Jongin Choi

customer_reviews.title: Has worked for a kids play toy
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for rowdy kids to try and get energy out during the cabin fever months. They have held up for that purpose, but I can't speak to how well they hold out for adult use.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great and exactly what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Great and exactly what I expected. I originally bought these to be used with one of my senior clients- but she loved them so much that she wanted her own set to play with her grandkids.
customer_reviews.author: HB Pilates

customer_reviews.title: A little light weight, but rugged.
customer_reviews.text: A little light weight, but rugged. would look for a little heavier mitt next time
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Me

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: The mitts feel lighter than I expected. The hand slots are soft leather (more likely soft fake leather), and are stitched on to the pad. The pad feels like a hard foam, and indents slightly when hit. After a few strong punches I noticed slight dents in the pads. The hand slots also seem to be designed with the intention that any hand will fit in them, left or right. The only drawback to this is that you never feel like you're holding it comfortably, however it is quite secure. It seems to get the job done and was a very reasonable price. I am satisfied and recommend this to anyone who is boxing on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: Ilya Kovic

customer_reviews.title: Decent pads for light training purposes-good value for the price
customer_reviews.text: These pads work well enough for light training exercises. I wouldn't use them with a professional fighter as they are light duty and probably not substantial enough for real power punches. The finger holes allow for a tighter grip than the other Everlast pads with just a strap and a couple of holes for multiple fingers-that type of pad grip can fly off if hit hard enough. Good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Not great for small hands.
customer_reviews.text: Wish the finger holes were a little smaller. Boyfriend seems to like them but when I have them on I have to curl my fingers to keep them from moving too much.
customer_reviews.author: Lyssa

customer_reviews.title: If your looking for cheap just to start out go ...
customer_reviews.text: If your looking for cheap just to start out go ahead these may be for you. If you think you'll stick with it then spend an extra $20 and get a real set of mitts that will last and protect your hands when training.
customer_reviews.author: David Weitzel

customer_reviews.title: I recommend you guys to grab some Panther claw (curved) punch ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't know where to begin on this. Lets start with the quality feel of these pads. The Panther grip hold feels so uncomfortable. The material used in the padding of the mitt gives no protection whatsoever. Can't even make snapping punches, snap... Very awkward to punch and hold. I recommend you guys to grab some Panther claw (curved) punch mitts. For just $30 it'll be more worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Decent Punch Mitts
customer_reviews.text: These mitts are definately not the best quality and they don't have a lot of give when punching. They are hard.. However- for at home martial arts practice, they do the job. The price makes them reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonLover

customer_reviews.title: Review for Everlast Punching Mitts
customer_reviews.text: ok for light training. do not expect these to last for "ever" though! the stitching is fairly cheap as well as the material. if you run a martial arts school i would invest in something a bit more substantial for continued use and abuse. otherwise, for me in light informal training they are fine.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Quality Construction and Great for Large Hands!
customer_reviews.text: These fit well and "stay put" on my very large hands...I can see how folks with small hands would be "swimming" in these. Solid build and protective...remember - they're punch mitts and not a heavy bag!
customer_reviews.author: PensFifthCup

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, my husband has big hands and he still has room!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Lowery

customer_reviews.title: Good Stuff
customer_reviews.text: Pretty legit. Works decent. the glove netting is shabby though so i dont expect it to last very long, but its so cheap i can buy 4 more
customer_reviews.author: Mizzy

customer_reviews.title: Great little mits
customer_reviews.text: Great little mits. Some of the stitching digs into one of my fingers but great for the price. I'm sure once they are broken in they will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: dan powers

customer_reviews.title: You want to work the mitts? Try these....
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. Descent quality without having to spend a lot of funds. Even if you are not a boxer in training these are awesome for cardio training. Yes, I would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Canfield

customer_reviews.title: These were gifts and the recipients loved them.
customer_reviews.text: Product delivered as described. These were gifts and the recipients loved them.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Miller

customer_reviews.title: Good for young boxers
customer_reviews.text: These mitts seem well constructed but I would not use them for adults doing boxing/conditioning. They just aren't large enough or offer enough padding to protect the wearer or to provide adequate feedback to the boxer. I would recommend these for young people (tweens) boxing.
customer_reviews.author: Reads2Escape

customer_reviews.title: Good for practicing taekwondo
customer_reviews.text: My girls use them to practice their punches and kicks. The hand insert works good for both adult and kids and it really helps them practice with having a target and not just kicking the air. They have held up to some pretty tough abuse and are not showing any signs of wear.
customer_reviews.author: Farmgirl

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Now these mitts are as described, but a warning for anyone who wants to use these for actual sparing - they are cheap. The materials are fine, but the pads are flat, have no contour, and are made out of a slick material so when you throw a punch your glove slides. Again, for the price I guess they are "OK" - but I would recommend spending a little extra money & getting a pair that are better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Dinger219

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: I love these! Bought them for my 7 year old that just started Tae Kwon do. He loves them and they are comfortable for my hands.
customer_reviews.author: hillaryann03

customer_reviews.title: i suck at mitts but i guess these are good for ...
customer_reviews.text: pads are stiff but does the job. i suck at mitts but i guess these are good for something unofficial in the back yard, i dont know how much abuse it can take so far after a few uses still looks good
customer_reviews.author: alex canas

customer_reviews.title: But maybe if we used them more they would be broken in better. They don't shape to the hand very well ...
customer_reviews.text: Just okay. They're kinda hard. Cheap. But maybe if we used them more they would be broken in better. They don't shape to the hand very well when holding them. Should be a bit more concave. They do the job though.
customer_reviews.author: M.B. DION

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: They can used a little more padding. But it does the job
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Better for me than a punching bag
customer_reviews.text: I am so excited to have the punch mitts to use with my Everlast Pro Style Training Gloves. The quality is amazing! Nice, thick padding and stitching made to last. Now, I can do my boxing exercises at home.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Good mitts for group boxing
customer_reviews.text: Mitts came exactly as pictured. I use these in my boxing classes and they hold up well. They get used 1 time a week and they're just now getting stretched out 2 years later.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: just what we needed for a replacement for my son. Loud thud when being popped.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: They're great!
customer_reviews.text: The punch mitts are great BUT bare in mind that they are YOUTHS (in my opinion). These are smaller in size diameter wise, I bought them with the intent on teaching my son how to hit. Everything came as expected if not better. The stitching on the gloves are good and they hold up very well. The padding on these is very good also. I would recommend these to any parent buying for thier child or youth.
customer_reviews.author: bravo0163

customer_reviews.title: Lasting pretty well.
customer_reviews.text: For using them a lot, they are holding up pretty well. And these were some of the cheaper punch mitts I could find. I am stationed overseas and do not have many places to buy this type of equipment, so I am glad I found these online.
customer_reviews.author: Junebug87

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My trainer and I have used 4 different kinds of mitts like this and these are the best by far. Even better than other Everlast ones we've tried. They are firm without being too dense. And he can really grip these and I can hit very hard without them coming off his hands.
customer_reviews.author: Jeaux

customer_reviews.title: HURTS REALLY BAD
customer_reviews.text: I'm a pretty athletic guy and I held pads for a 110lb female. My fingers were jamming against the pad from some regular mitt work. I definitely would go with a more curved option for mitts.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Hu

customer_reviews.title: Fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking to start into the boxing, figthing or aerobics, this is what you need. These pair are not the proffesional size though, but for any begginer will do just fine
customer_reviews.author: Guillermo Olivares

customer_reviews.title: Not for women hands or guys with smaller hands
customer_reviews.text: If you getting these and you don’t have big man hands the mits will most likely not stay on your hands there is no strap to tighten them on. Material is good for the part you punch.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: It came in quick and it is a very good quality. I am giving 4 stars because I ...
customer_reviews.text: It came in quick and it is a very good quality. I am giving 4 stars because I do not give 5 stars unless and until i find something very very good.
customer_reviews.author: Asif Kidwai

customer_reviews.title: ... okay for beginners (Which i am) but they feel like if they are made out of Styrofoam
customer_reviews.text: They are okay for beginners (Which i am) but they feel like if they are made out of Styrofoam. They have lasted so far, but I like them as an alternative to expensive boxing mitts. If you need a quick solution buy these if not invest in more quality ones.
customer_reviews.author: Chavarria

customer_reviews.title: Great Pads
customer_reviews.text: These are great pads to start off on, but if you are advanced I recommend a high brand. These are pretty stiff, but you are punching it so in time they will be easier to hit. Also, one other thing is the fact the you cant adjust the hand straps, its a one size fits all, and I have a small hand so if punched hard enough it would just fall off.
customer_reviews.author: Juan

customer_reviews.title: "The More You Practice The Luckier You Get"
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality with a great lightweight carrying case. Easy to travel with or keep at home when you're looking to keep practicing when you're not at the dojo or gym or if you're just working out on the cheap and not going to any classes.
customer_reviews.author: THOMAS

customer_reviews.title: Good padding
customer_reviews.text: Daughter is in karate and we get to spare from time to time, she packs a mean punch and these pad my hands well
customer_reviews.author: Abbey Adams

customer_reviews.title: Great if your child is learning Martial Arts.
customer_reviews.text: These are simple, but adequate for a youth learning a martial art. If it's a teenager hitting hard, they might not last that long.
customer_reviews.author: Chad D. Laibly

customer_reviews.title: great quality would buy them again
customer_reviews.text: what time for my daughter who is a boxer and is in training great quality, n great buy, my daughter TesfayeBeale, she is also a professional trainer look her up on facebook. . S.I.N.Y.LADYRIDER
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.FilomeanaParesiBealePark

customer_reviews.title: A great way to introduce friends or family to boxing practice
customer_reviews.text: Kinda lightweight, but has held up for casual punch practice. A great way to introduce friends or family to boxing practice.
customer_reviews.author: Red M.

customer_reviews.title: Good, but a little thin.
customer_reviews.text: These are great--Everlast always makes good products. The only reason I am going with 4 stars out of 5 is that these are lightweight mitts and should be advertised as such. Awesome when working with kids for both speed and power drills. But, while my hands are fairly solid, some people working with adults who have serious striking power might find the protection against punches and more specifically kicks a little bit lacking.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Kittrell

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done but they feel a little cheap. Very hard to the touch when you punch.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Works great for sparring
customer_reviews.text: Works great for sparring, We were nervous that my husband wouldn't be able to go hard enough to make it a workout, but they allow him to box pretty hard without hurting me. I'm 5'6" and my husband is 6'1' and they hold up nice.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Rueb

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My kid still uses these to play with years after buy
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Everything’s good but they are a little light and feel cheap, so one star deducted
customer_reviews.author: D. G.

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you understand these are, at best, for small children first learning to punch. Do not buy for any type of Adult use.
customer_reviews.author: vaughn honeycutt

customer_reviews.title: stiff, but effective
customer_reviews.text: a little stiff to punch and, but considering the price these are fine. One size fits all mitts are lose on my wife's hands, but putting on her cotton driving gloves made them snug.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Bought these for my 7 yr old to train with ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my 7 yr old to train with. He loves them and for the price paid it was a steal.
customer_reviews.author: Happy in AZ

customer_reviews.title: My kids use these with boxing gloves and take turns ...
customer_reviews.text: My kids use these with boxing gloves and take turns being coach and fighter. They have a blast and they also fit my hands.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: These are great. They are well made and fit all members of my house. You do want gloves if you are going to use these or the one wearing them will feel it more. I recommend these for anyone that is training or using them for exercise.
customer_reviews.author: SkyHawk

customer_reviews.title: Decent mitts...
customer_reviews.text: Good mitts for the price, decent padding and fit, perfect for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Mitts
customer_reviews.text: Is it good for moderate hitting. It isn't as good as some I've used before but those were for the professionals. But for the price I paid for these mitts, I can't complain.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Tuik

customer_reviews.title: a really like it
customer_reviews.text: beautiful punch mitts, i'm doing my mitts drill and realaly confy
customer_reviews.author: felipe castellanos

customer_reviews.title: these are fine. But if you want a good punching mitt
customer_reviews.text: If cheap is what you're going for, these are fine. But if you want a good punching mitt, spend the money on something better. The "feedback" you get from a good punching mitt is worth the extra money. There is nothing gratifying about punching these mitts. I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price. Not going for the title here just using with some of my training clients in their workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Pruitt

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: Gift for another person who is very satisfied with the item.
customer_reviews.author: Shegun

customer_reviews.title: Good targets for Sumo Slap Attack
customer_reviews.text: Works well when I practice my "Violent Sumo Hands" slap attack, for me anyway. Like the Thai Pad, my daughter complains that her wrists hurt and bruising after I'm done. I told her it was good practice for marriage.
customer_reviews.author: Yes, I actually bought it.

customer_reviews.title: Horrible cheap quality .. Don't bother
customer_reviews.text: Omg these things are so bad. Don't waste your time. I returned them and got the ones from Meister.. Way better
customer_reviews.author: Chris Smith

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice pads! I have been boxing with them for a few weeks and they look fine!
customer_reviews.author: Vasilios Chatzigiannis

customer_reviews.title: Nice fit. They'll take a punch
customer_reviews.text: Nice fit. They'll take a punch, but probably not kicks. They're big enough so a punch won't slip off and catch you in the face.
customer_reviews.author: AJ Cabrera

customer_reviews.title: They work great for for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 8 year old and 6 year old. They work great for for beginners. Also, the price was great...$10 less than local stores.
customer_reviews.author: MMorgan

customer_reviews.title: Decent product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 12 yr old. Decent quality and serves its purpose. The grip for the holder could be a little better but for the price, can't really complain.
customer_reviews.author: Damien Caban

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect much from these cheap mitts
customer_reviews.text: I give it two starts because of the low price, but you'll get what you pay for. Spend a little more and get better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Engner

customer_reviews.title: Good for those times when you want to punch someone's naked hand!
customer_reviews.text: They do not stay on very well during an active punching drill
customer_reviews.author: SunnyDaze

customer_reviews.title: Boy prezzie
customer_reviews.text: These were for my son who takes karate and he was thrilled to get them out of the box. He has been working so hard and these are a reward for earning his high orange belt this week. Thanks for the easy delivery and no problems with the wuality.
customer_reviews.author: rennmonkey

customer_reviews.title: Worth It
customer_reviews.text: Timely shipping. Good quality. Nice and light for the wearer. Comfortable for the puncher. Good price. Apparently some people don't know to wear good hand protection when punching things, so make sure you do your research and invest in good quality hand protection, otherwise you can mess up your nerves and tendons. Seriously. Be wary of just using handwraps or light bag gloves. Ask someone knowledgeable if you're unsure.
customer_reviews.author: person

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: They are worn in but still together. Everlast equipment aren't like the gloves Everlast produce. Much more durable for some reason, or at least the stuff I've received has been so far.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck D

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: They work great the glove part is kinda iffy but it works great
customer_reviews.author: Eric Dennis jr

product_meta.title: Everlast 4318 Punch Mitts
product_meta.description:
Punching mitt to sharpen ones technique.

Warranty:

Everlast warrants its products to be free from defects in materials and workmanship for a period of 120 days from date of purchase, provided they have not been subjected to obvious abuse, neglect or misuse. Everlast's sole liability is limited to repairing or replacing products that are returned within this 120-day period, unless specific product literature specifies otherwise.

Please contact customer service for full details, and for replacement assistance at 1-800-821-7930.



AMAZON.COM
These durable punching mitts, from leading boxing gear maker Everlast, help boxers sharpen their technique. Made of durable, premium synthetic polycanvas for long lasting durability and functionality, they feature an improved design to increase functionality by including a full glove backing.



A must have for any serious boxing training session, punching mitts help you hone technique while protecting your partner's hands.  About Everlast
The preeminent brand in boxing since 1910, Everlast is a leader in the design, manufacturing, licensing, and marketing of authentic boxing, mixed martial arts, and fitness-related sporting goods equipment, apparel, footwear, and accessories. From heavyweight champion Jack Dempsey and middleweight legend Sugar Ray Robinson to middleweight champion Jermain Taylor and UFC heavyweight champion Randy Couture, Everlast is the brand of choice for generations of professional fighters.
feature_bullets: Durable punching mitts from leading boxing gear maker Everlast
Made of durable, premium synthetic polycanvas for long lasting durability and functionality
Feature improved design to increase functionality by including full glove backing

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
